message.text:
This regression does not converge. Check your derivatives, 
let genfit calculate the derivatives numerically, 
check your model for singularities, 
or try different initial guesses.
The "combine" keyword does not recognize the specified target modifier.
The "rewrite" keyword does not recognize the specified target modifier.
The "using" keyword cannot rename a variable used in the original expression.
The "using" keyword cannot rename a variable that does not newly appear in the result expression.
This regression does not converge. Check your model for singularities, \nor try different initial guesses.
This problem is unstable, so the step size is becoming too small. \nTry reducing the integration interval.
This solution exceeds the maximum number of integration steps. \nTry reducing the size of the integration interval.
Singular system.
The return value of this function must match the problem size.
This program has no return value. You must account for all cases \nwhen using conditional statements in a Mathcad program.
Cannot find expression for highest order derivative.
Cannot deduce initial conditions.
The number of steps must be less than or equal to the input length.
The number of steps must be at least two.
Argument outside of solution interval.
Invalid independent variable.
Could not load symbolic processor
The left temporal endpoint must be less than the right.

message.short_name: number of guess values must be 3
message.text: The number of guess values must be 3.
System too large.
WAV file is not PCM format.
Non-scalar differentiation result.
There are no valid points to plot.
This system of equations has more\nunknowns than equations.
This matrix needs more than one subscript. Be sure\nyou separated your subscripts with a comma.
This array has more elements than can be displayed in matrix form.\nTry using the 'submatrix' function, or display as a scrolling table.
The symbolic result returned is too large to display,\nbut it can be used in subsequent calculations if assigned\nto a function or variable.
Can't solve a system with this many equations.
This array has too many subscripts. Use one\nsubscript for a vector or two for a matrix.
This array must have at least two rows representing at least two colors.
Search has reached the end of the Document.\nContinue at the top?
Search has reached the top of the Document.\nContinue at the bottom?
Cursor must be on an answer.
Viewing original section will discard your edits.\nSave edits to this section?

Cannot open another window.
Confidence level must be in the interval [0.5,1.0].
Will abort printing.
Number used in place of unknown.
To delete an operator, click on it first.
Preprocessor error: null pointer encountered
Definitions are not allowed inside solve blocks.
This expression cannot be evaluated. It may have\nresulted in an overflow or infinite recursion.
"Given" can only be used to open a solve block.
Can't understand this expression.

Compositional powers are only defined for\nfunctions which take a single argument.
The keyword is invalid.
The arguments are invalid.
This operation cannot be performed on an array.\nTry using 'vectorize' to perform it element by element.
The boundary conditions are not consistent with \nthe endpoints specified for the spatial range.
The number of functions must match the number of initial conditions.
The number of functions must match the number of equations.

Second-order or higher time derivatives are not allowed.
An internal compiler error has occured.
No "Given" found to open this solve block.

This range variable must be defined with sequential values.
These values can not be compared.
Error in initial conditions.
This expression cannot be evaluated. It may have\nresulted in an overflow or infinite recursion.
Error in ODE block.
The algebraic constraints are not \nsatisfied at the initial point.
Something is wrong with the solve block used to define this function.
This is not allowed inside a solve block.
No matching values were found.
The initial conditions are not consistent with \nthe endpoints specified for the temporal range.
A function may have at most two Dirichlet \nboundary conditions and two Neumann boundary conditions.

Endpoints must be real numbers.
This variable is undefined.
This variable reference is ambiguous.
This parameter is inaccessable; it is hidden \nby another with the same name.
This number is too large.
This number contains an invalid character '%2'.
This name is too long.
This number contains an invalid character '%2'.
This number contains an invalid character '%2'.
This string contains a bad\ncharacter escape sequence.
This string has more than %3 characters.\nDefine it as separate strings and concatenate them.
This definition forms part of a dependency cycle.
There are too many commas in this expression.
This 'break' must occur within a loop.
This 'continue' must occur within a loop.
A name is required here.
This 'otherwise' must match an 'if'.
The expression to the left of the equal sign cannot be defined.
This range variable is not referenced in the left hand side of the definition.
This '(' requires a matching ')'.
This placeholder is empty.
The '%3' pseudo-function requires exactly %4\narguments and cannot be redefined.
Cannot understand this syntax.
This function refers to itself inconsistently.
The forms of the expression and its error handler must match.\nThe expression has the form: %8, \nbut the handler has the form: %9.
This function requires 1 argument but is applied to %1.
The forms of the possible return values must match.\nThe first has the form: %8, \nbut the second has the form: %9.
This function accepts at most %1 arguments\nbut is applied to %2.
This function requires at least %1 arguments\nbut is applied to %2.
This keyword requires 1 argument but is applied to %1.
This keyword requires 1 argument but is applied to %1.
This keyword accepts at most %1 arguments\nbut is applied to %2.
This keyword requires at least %1 arguments\nbut is applied to %2.
Dimensioned ranges must specify the second value in the range.
This value must be a function, \nbut has the form: %1.
This function has the form: %2, \nbut must have the form: %1.
This function accepts a variable number of arguments\nso cannot be passed as an argument.
This value has the form: %2,\nbut must have the form: %1.
The forms of these values must match.\nThis value has the form: %1, \nbut others have the form: %2.
message.comments: The phrase 'These values...' is deliberately ambiguous; the message is used in several contexts in which expressions are constrained to have the same static type, including matrix elements, n-ary function argument lists, and plot markers.

message.text: The exponentiation operator requires a constant \nexponent when applied to a value with units.
The nth root operator requires a constant \nradical when applied to a value with units.
The order of the derivative must be a constant \nbetween 1 and 5 when this operator is applied \nto an expression with units.
The determinant operator requires a square \nmatrix of unitless values. This matrix has \nelements of the form: %2.
This exponent must have a denominator that is a factor of 60000 \nto be applied to a value with units.
This radical is too large to be extracted \nfrom a value with units.
This value has units: %2, \nbut must have units: %1.

message.comments: The data, image, signal, and wavelets libraries throw this error if a Flex license can't be checked out. The %1 parameter is replaced with a code that won't mean much to the user, but will help tech support identify the function pack.

This word will be reserved for use in the UI. Please leave it as just this word. Don't remove. Don't uppercase. Don't add punctuation. See Kent Pitman for details.
